2021-09-30.name: Oktoberfest
2021-09-30.summary: At this big riverfront festival, there's food, music and carnival rides, plus the opening Torchlight Parade and the Maple Leaf Parade on Saturday morning.

2021-09-15.name: Pumpkin Festival
2021-09-15.summary: This town near Peoria, home of the Libby's pumpkin-packing plant, calls itself the Pumpkin Capital of the World. The festival features pumpkin-boat races, pumpkin decorating, pie-eating contests, a craft fair, a pumpkin-pancake breakfast and a 10:30 a.m. Saturday parade.

2021-09-16.name: Pumpkin Festival
2021-09-16.summary: This town near Peoria, home of the Libby's pumpkin-packing plant, calls itself the Pumpkin Capital of the World. The festival features pumpkin-boat races, pumpkin decorating, pie-eating contests, a craft fair, a pumpkin-pancake breakfast and a 10:30 a.m. Saturday parade.

2021-09-16.name: Summerfest
2021-09-16.summary: They call this the world's largest music festival. More than 1,000 acts perform on 12 stages along Lake Michigan.

2021-09-17.name: Pumpkin Festival

2021-09-17.summary: They call this the world's largest music festival. More than 1,000 acts perform on 12 stages along Lake Michigan.

2021-09-17.name: Wo-Zha-Wa Days
2021-09-17.summary: There's a juried arts and             crafts show, a flea maraket, a street carnival and a parade Sunday.

2021-09-17.name: Unplugged music festival
2021-09-17.summary: The harbor-side North House Folk School celebrates with storytelling, traditional workshops, a fish boil and  concerts by songwriter/musicians.

2021-09-17.name: World Food & Music Festival
2021-09-17.summary: In downtown's East Village, eat at more than 50 cultural cafes for $5 or less (or taste for $1), shop at the world marketplace or listen to musicians strolling the streets or on stage.

2021-09-17.name: Twin Cities Jazz Festival
2021-09-17.summary: Listen to jazz in Mears Park, in St. Paul's Lowertown.

2021-09-17.name: Grape Stomp
2021-09-17.summary: Carlos Creek Winery hosts this festival, which features music on two stages, an art fair, grape stomps and "I Love Lucy'' look-alike contests.

2021-09-17.name: Riot Fest
2021-09-17.summary: This Douglas Park music festival also features a circus sideshow revue and carnival.

2021-09-17.name: Wauktoberfest
2021-09-17.summary: This town just north of Madison celebrates with a craft-beer tasting, bike tour, music and lots of contests: frau carrying, yodeling, beer keg race, dachshund dash and Limburger cheese and sauerkraut eating.

2021-09-17.name: Gemuetlichkeit Days
2021-09-17.summary: This festival between Madison and Milwaukee is named for the German word for a cozy and congenial atmosphere. It includes sauerkraut-eating, nail-driving, facial hair and costume contests, a vintage car show, music and a parade at noon Sunday.

2021-09-17.name: Hot Air Balloon Days
2021-09-17.summary: In this town southwest of Des Moines, there are balloon races and night glows, a parade with marching-band contest, an arts and crafts fair and a flea market.

2021-09-17.name: Mahkato Wacipi
2021-09-17.summary: This traditional powwow in Land of Memories Park commemorates the 38 Dakota who were hanged after the 1862 U.S.-Dakota war.

2021-09-17.name: Oktoberfestival
2021-09-17.summary: This festival on the bayfront features stein-holding, barrel-rolling and pretzel-tossing contests, a kids' zone and a dachshund derby on Sunday, plus German food and music. Admission is $20, $10 up to week of event, free for youths 15 and under.

2021-09-18.summary: In this town southwest of Des Moines, there are balloon races and night glows, a parade with marching-band contest, an arts and crafts fair and a flea market.

2021-09-18.name: Mahkato Wacipi
2021-09-18.summary: This traditional powwow in Land of Memories Park commemorates the 38 Dakota who were hanged after the 1862 U.S.-Dakota war.

2021-09-18.summary: This festival on the bayfront features stein-holding, barrel-rolling and pretzel-tossing contests, a kids' zone and a dachshund derby on Sunday, plus German food and music. Admission is $20, $10 up to week of event, free for youths 15 and under.

2021-09-18.name: Wine & Harvest Festival
2021-09-18.summary: There's a pumpkin regatta — yes, people paddling hollowed-out pumpkins across Cedar Creek — at the fest in this historic mill town just north of Milwaukee. There's also a scarecrow contest, grape stomp, hay rides, juried arts fair and lots of food.

2021-09-18.name: World War II Days
2021-09-18.summary: Midway Village Museum hosts one of the largest World War II battle re-enactments in the nation, with more than 1,200 uniformed re-enactors and more than 60 vintage tanks and other armored vehicles.

2021-09-18.name: Bacon Bash
2021-09-18.summary: There will be pig races, a pig-calling contest, pig crafts, an amateur bacon cook-off and many bacon dishes, including ice cream.

2021-09-18.name: Art and Apples on the Lake
2021-09-18.summary: On the shore of Lake Minnetonka, Art on the Lake combines with Apple Day, with an art fair, apple pie-eating contest, music and a street dance.

2021-09-18.name: Audubon Days
2021-09-18.summary: The festival in this town next to big Horicon Marsh             features bed races, a car show, craft fair, bag tournament and music.

2021-09-18.name: Parade of Nations and Multicultural Festival
2021-09-18.summary: The parade begins in Hancock and ends in Houghton at Dee Stadium, where there's a festival with music, dancing and food from around the world.

2021-09-18.name: Taste of the Trail
2021-09-18.summary: On the Harmony-Preston Valley State Trail, sample local treats, listen to music, visit the National Trout Center, take wagon rides and play games.

2021-09-18.name: Scarecrow Fest
2021-09-18.summary: See early fall color around this town in Nicolet National Forest. There's pumpkin-chucking, pumpkin and scarecrow contests, a craft fair, car show, hay rides and free chili and deep-fried pickles.

2021-09-18.name: Party on the Pavement
2021-09-18.summary: Racine's biggest street festival features stages of entertainment and a car show, art walk, carnival rides and zones for kids and sports.

2021-09-18.name: Harvest Fest & Street Art Auction
2021-09-18.summary: This street party includes a car show, cornhole and chalk-art contests, music and artisans and winds up with the auction of 25 artist-created cherries.

2021-09-18.name: Museum Day
2021-09-18.summary: Smithsonian magazine and participating museums in every state offer free admission for two people. Tickets are available for download on the website.

2021-09-18.name: Greenway Glow
2021-09-18.summary: Along the Midtown Greenway bike route in south Minneapolis, enjoy live music, art installations and theatrical performances from 4 to 10 p.m.

2021-09-18.name: Squidfest
2021-09-18.summary: The inaugural festival in this Minnesota River Valley town features a 10:30 a.m. parade, a disc golf tournament, street performance, kids' activities, art and live music all day. There's also a Ribfest.

2021-09-02.name: Summerfest
2021-09-02.summary: They call this the world's largest music festival. More than 1,000 acts perform on 12 stages along Lake Michigan.

2021-09-02.name: Minnesota State Fair
2021-09-02.summary: Try flights at the Craft Beer Hall, eat food on a stick, listen to free concerts and watch the 2 p.m. daily parade.

2021-09-02.name: Midwest Old Threshers Reunion
2021-09-02.summary: This gathering of steam engines and antique cars, trucks and tractors also features a horse pull, concerts, square dancing and a parade.

2021-09-03.name: Summerfest
2021-09-03.summary: They call this the world's largest music festival. More than 1,000 acts perform on 12 stages along Lake Michigan.

2021-09-03.summary: This gathering of steam engines and antique cars, trucks and tractors also features a horse pull, concerts, square dancing and a parade.

2021-09-03.name: Western Minnesota Steam Threshers Reunion
2021-09-03.summary: Revel in the past during this show of antique machinery, which includes rides on trains and a carousel, square dancing, roving musicians and nightly jamborees.

2021-09-03.name: Marquette Area Blues Fest
2021-09-03.summary: Enjoy a weekend of music in             Mattson Lower Harbor Park on Lake Superior.

2021-09-04.name: Summerfest
2021-09-04.summary: They call this the world's largest music festival. More than 1,000 acts perform on 12 stages along Lake Michigan.

2021-09-04.summary: Revel in the past during this show of antique machinery, which includes rides on trains and a carousel, square dancing, roving musicians and nightly jamborees.

2021-09-04.name: Frankfort Fall Festival
2021-09-04.summary: The festival in this southern suburb of Chicago features more than 300 artisans, music, a carnival and a parade Sunday.

2021-09-04.name: Fox Valley Folk Music & Storytelling Festival
2021-09-04.summary: Musicians and storytellers perform on eight stages at this festival in Island Park on the Fox River.

2021-09-04.name: Marina Fest
2021-09-04.summary: In this Door County village, there will be a vintage boat show, craft fair,  kids' carnival, music and Saturday fireworks.

2021-09-04.name: Marquette Area Blues Fest
2021-09-04.summary: Enjoy a weekend of music in             Mattson Lower Harbor Park on Lake Superior.

2021-09-04.name: Taste of Madison
2021-09-04.summary: This free benefit festival on Capitol Square includes 200 menu items from more than 80 restaurants, all priced at $1-$4. There's also music on three stages.

2021-09-04.name: Fox Jazz Festival
2021-09-04.summary: This free Fox Cities jazz festival is in Jefferson Park, on the shores of Lake Winnebago.

2021-09-04.name: Wisconsin State Cow Chip Throw
2021-09-04.summary: There's chip-chucking contests in this Wisconsin River town, but also music, kids' games and an arts and crafts fair.

2021-09-04.name: Kites Over Lake Michigan
2021-09-04.summary: On Neshotah Beach, watch giant kites, precision stunt teams, a release of sky lanterns and fireworks. There will be live music Saturday night and free kite-making for kids on Saturday.

2021-09-09.name: Summerfest
2021-09-09.summary: They call this the world's largest music festival. More than 1,000 acts perform on 12 stages along Lake Michigan.

2021-09-09.name: Defeat of Jesse James Days
2021-09-09.summary: In this college town south of the Twin Cities, there's a fine-arts festival, tractor pulls, a bike tour, reenactments of the famous bank raid and a Sunday parade.

2021-09-09.name: Sandwich Fair
2021-09-09.summary: This northeast Illinois fair, held since 1888, features exhibits, entertainment and music plus harness racing, tractor pulls and demolition derbies.

2021-09-10.name: Summerfest
2021-09-10.summary: They call this the world's largest music festival. More than 1,000 acts perform on 12 stages along Lake Michigan.

2021-09-10.name: Defeat of Jesse James Days

2021-09-10.name: Sandwich Fair
2021-09-10.summary: This northeast Illinois fair, held since 1888, features exhibits, entertainment and music plus harness racing, tractor pulls and demolition derbies.

2021-09-10.name: James J. Hill Days
2021-09-10.summary: This Minneapolis suburb features a street market and carnival; dachshund races, a craft-beer fest, logrolling and fireworks on Saturday; and a parade on Sunday.

2021-09-10.name: Villa Louis Carriage Classic
2021-09-10.summary: The Victorian estate on the Mississippi River hosts horses, restored carriages and drivers in period dress for             competitive arena and cross-country sport driving, a passion of the frontier aristocrats who built it.

2021-09-10.name: Festival of the Vine
2021-09-10.summary: There's an arts and crafts show, flower market, music, wine tasting and sampling of food from local restaurants.

2021-09-10.name: Paw Paw Wine & Harvest Festival
2021-09-10.summary: This big festival in southwest Michigan wine country features music on three stages, Friday fireworks, an art fair, motorcycle and bicycle tours, grape stomps and a Sunday parade.

2021-09-10.name: Basilica Block Party
2021-09-10.summary: Praise the Loud at this ticketed rock-music fest at the Basilica of St. Mary on the edge of downtown.

2021-09-10.name: Harvest Moon Festival
2021-09-10.summary: In Whiteside Park, there's an arts fair plus music, an old-time medicine show and pony rides and a petting zoo for kids.

2021-09-10.name: Classic Boat & Schooner Rendezvous
2021-09-10.summary: Schooners and sloops will gather in this Lake Superior town. There will be activities for children, an open house at the Coast Guard station and a Saturday boat parade.

2021-09-10.name: Grand Rapids Riverfest
2021-09-10.summary: This inaugural music festival downtown features Trampled by Turtles, Yonder Mountain String Band, The Brothers Burn Mountain and Charlie Parr.

2021-09-11.name: Summerfest
2021-09-11.summary: They call this the world's largest music festival. More than 1,000 acts perform on 12 stages along Lake Michigan.

2021-09-11.name: Basilica Block Party

2021-09-11.name: Classic Boat & Schooner Rendezvous
2021-09-11.summary: Schooners and sloops will gather in this Lake Superior town. There will be activities for children, an open house at the Coast Guard station and a Saturday boat parade.

2021-09-11.name: Grand Rapids Riverfest
2021-09-11.summary: This inaugural music festival downtown features Trampled by Turtles, Yonder Mountain String Band, The Brothers Burn Mountain and Charlie Parr.

2021-09-11.name: Rock Bend Folk Festival
2021-09-11.summary: This free, easygoing festival is in this Minnesota River town's Minnesota Square Park.

2021-09-11.name: Laura Ingalls Wilder Days
2021-09-11.summary: The famous author's birthplace celebrates this year with a scaled-down festival this year at the Laura Ingalls Wilder Museum, including traditional music and crafts, pie-eating and fiddling.

2021-09-11.name: Ethnic Fest
2021-09-11.summary: Alphornists, Scandinavian dancers and Anishinaabe drum and dance corps perform in this town on the shores of Leech Lake. There's also a parade.

2021-09-11.name: Washington County Bluegrass Festival
2021-09-11.summary: Bluegrass bands will play at this family festival at Lake Elmo Park Reserve at the eastern edge of the Twin Cities, free with $7 vehicle permit. There also will be camping and food vendors.

2021-09-11.name: Taste of the Trail
2021-09-11.summary: In Lanesboro, Whalan and Peterson on the Root River State Trail, enjoy music, wagon rides and free samples from local restaurants and growers.

2021-09-11.name: Mural Fest
2021-09-11.summary: Go on guided tours of Ashland's famous murals, meet the artists and go on a mural scavenger hunt. There's also food, music, crafts and a car show.

2021-09-11.name: Sputnikfest
2021-09-11.summary: Help celebrate the 1962 crash landing of a 20-pound piece of Russia's Sputnik on a street in Manitowoc. There's a wacky costume contest, a Miss Space Debris pageant, a pet costume contest, a space-themed movie and music.

2021-09-11.name: Whooping Crane Festival
2021-09-11.summary: Celebrate the whooping-crane migration with voyageur canoe trips, a marketplace, crane trivia, children's activities and bird walks.

2021-09-11.name: Radio Waves Music Festival
2021-09-11.summary: WTIP, North Shore Community Radio, hosts this outdoor fest of more than 25 local and regional music acts next to the municipal campground.

2021-09-11.name: Monarch Festival
2021-09-11.summary: This festival at Lake Nokomis celebrates the monarch migration from Minnesota to Mexico and includes a costume parade, music, dance, art activities and monarch games.

2021-09-11.name: Little Falls Arts & Crafts Fair
2021-09-11.summary: This large fair, with nearly 600 artists, includes a car show and an antiques and collectibles section as well as a Man Cave.

2021-09-19.name: Wo-Zha-Wa Days
2021-09-19.summary: There's a juried arts and             crafts show, a flea maraket, a street carnival and a parade Sunday.

2021-09-12.summary: This northeast Illinois fair, held since 1888, features exhibits, entertainment and music plus harness racing, tractor pulls and demolition derbies.

2021-09-12.name: James J. Hill Days
2021-09-12.summary: This Minneapolis suburb features a street market and carnival; dachshund races, a craft-beer fest, logrolling and fireworks on Saturday; and a parade on Sunday.

2021-09-12.name: Villa Louis Carriage Classic
2021-09-12.summary: The Victorian estate on the Mississippi River hosts horses, restored carriages and drivers in period dress for             competitive arena and cross-country sport driving, a passion of the frontier aristocrats who built it.

2021-09-12.name: Festival of the Vine
2021-09-12.summary: There's an arts and crafts show, flower market, music, wine tasting and sampling of food from local restaurants.

2021-09-12.name: Paw Paw Wine & Harvest Festival
2021-09-12.summary: This big festival in southwest Michigan wine country features music on three stages, Friday fireworks, an art fair, motorcycle and bicycle tours, grape stomps and a Sunday parade.

2021-09-12.name: Harvest Moon Festival
2021-09-12.summary: In Whiteside Park, there's an arts fair plus music, an old-time medicine show and pony rides and a petting zoo for kids.

2021-09-12.name: Classic Boat & Schooner Rendezvous
2021-09-12.summary: Schooners and sloops will gather in this Lake Superior town. There will be activities for children, an open house at the Coast Guard station and a Saturday boat parade.

2021-09-12.name: Rock Bend Folk Festival
2021-09-12.summary: This free, easygoing festival is in this Minnesota River town's Minnesota Square Park.

2021-09-12.name: Little Falls Arts & Crafts Fair
2021-09-12.summary: This large fair, with nearly 600 artists, includes a car show and an antiques and collectibles section as well as a Man Cave.

2021-09-12.name: St. Paul Classic Bike Tour
2021-09-12.summary: Ride a 15-, 30- or 45-mile route along the Mississippi, lakes Como and Phalen and St. Paul parkways, starting and ending at the University of St. Thomas and punctuated by food and live music.

2021-09-12.name: Scandinavian Day
2021-09-12.summary: This festival in Vasa Park, along the Fox River, features music, dancing, food and crafts from the Nordic countries.

2021-09-23.name: Oktoberfest
2021-09-23.summary: There will be music, wagon rides, chainsaw carving, children's activities and, of course, beer from New Glarus Brewing.

2021-09-23.name: Oktoberfest of Greater Racine
2021-09-23.summary: Lakefront Brewery hosts this free, family-friendly festival at Franksville Craft Beer Garden, featuring stein-hoisting and nail-driving contests, yard games, a pig roast, live music, bounce houses for the kids and two dozen craft beers on tap.

2021-09-23.name: Boats and Bluegrass
2021-09-23.summary: This family-oriented festival in Prairie Island Park, on the Mississippi River, features disc golf and paddling as well as music. A weekend pass includes camping and canoeing, and kids under 16 are free with an adult ticket. Buy tickets early to save money.

2021-09-24.name: Oktoberfest
2021-09-24.summary: There will be music, wagon rides, chainsaw carving, children's activities and, of course, beer from New Glarus Brewing.

2021-09-24.name: Oktoberfest of Greater Racine
2021-09-24.summary: Lakefront Brewery hosts this free, family-friendly festival at Franksville Craft Beer Garden, featuring stein-hoisting and nail-driving contests, yard games, a pig roast, live music, bounce houses for the kids and two dozen craft beers on tap.

2021-09-24.name: Cornish Festival
2021-09-24.summary: In the old lead-mining district in southwest Wisconsin, play shove ha'penny in the Kiddleywink Pub, eat figgyhobbin and pasties, listen to tommyknocker tales and tour Cornish miners' cottages.

2021-09-24.name: Apple Festival
2021-09-24.summary: There'll be arts and crafts and music in this southwest Wisconsin village. The big parade is Sunday.

2021-09-24.name: Cranberry Festival
2021-09-24.summary: At this huge festival in west-central Wisconsin, there'll be marsh tours, pie-eating contests and more than 1,000 booths selling antiques, produce and arts and crafts.

2021-09-24.name: Milwaukee Oktoberfest
2021-09-24.summary: There will be dachshund racing, stein-hoisting and brat-eating competitions as well as music and dancing at the War Memorial on the lakefront.

2021-09-24.name: Red Cliff Cultural Days
2021-09-24.summary: At this Ojibwe community just north of Bayfield, there will be a mini-powwow, sailboat rides, canoe races, traditional games, music, fireworks and sky lanterns.

2021-09-24.name: Harvest Fair
2021-09-24.summary: This free festival at the Wisconsin State Fairgrounds features lumberjack shows, pumpkin bowling, scarecrow-making, kids' rides and entertainment on three stages.

2021-09-24.name: Boats and Bluegrass
2021-09-24.summary: This family-oriented festival in Prairie Island Park, on the Mississippi River, features disc golf and paddling as well as music. A weekend pass includes camping and canoeing, and kids under 16 are free with an adult ticket. Buy tickets early to save money.

2021-09-24.name: German Fest
2021-09-24.summary: There will be music, dancing, children's             games and lock and dam tours in this antebellum town on the Mississippi River.

2021-09-24.name: Fall Fest
2021-09-24.summary: In the colorful northwest Wisconsin woods, there'll be hay rides, corn maze, a chili cook-off, fish boil, arts and crafts and fireworks.

2021-09-24.name: Kalona Fall Festival
2021-09-24.summary: This Mennonite community just southwest of Iowa City, famous for its quilts, offers pony rides, a pumpkin-carving contest, demonstrations of Old World artisanry, music and homemade potato chips, apple fritters, ice cream and chicken, biscuits and gravy.

2021-09-24.name: Oktoberfest
2021-09-24.summary: Take polka-dancing lessons, enter the Bier Maiden or stein-holding contests and win costume prizes at this outdoor fest under tents  downtown.

2021-09-24.name: Octoberfest
2021-09-24.summary: This large downtown festival is more general civic celebration than German  festival, with an arts and crafts show, car show and music on five  stages.

2021-09-24.name: Chicago Live Again!
2021-09-24.summary: More than 40 of Chicago's marquee attractions, including the Joffrey Ballet, Chicago Symphony Orchestra, Lyric Opera and Second City will provide free, outdoors non-stop entertainment at Navy Pier to celebrate the return of live performance to Chicago.

2021-09-25.name: Oktoberfest
2021-09-25.summary: There will be music, wagon rides, chainsaw carving, children's activities and, of course, beer from New Glarus Brewing.

2021-09-25.name: Oktoberfest of Greater Racine
2021-09-25.summary: Lakefront Brewery hosts this free, family-friendly festival at Franksville Craft Beer Garden, featuring stein-hoisting and nail-driving contests, yard games, a pig roast, live music, bounce houses for the kids and two dozen craft beers on tap.

2021-09-25.name: Cornish Festival
2021-09-25.summary: In the old lead-mining district in southwest Wisconsin, play shove ha'penny in the Kiddleywink Pub, eat figgyhobbin and pasties, listen to tommyknocker tales and tour Cornish miners' cottages.

2021-09-25.name: Apple Festival
2021-09-25.summary: There'll be arts and crafts and music in this southwest Wisconsin village. The big parade is Sunday.

2021-09-25.name: Cranberry Festival
2021-09-25.summary: At this huge festival in west-central Wisconsin, there'll be marsh tours, pie-eating contests and more than 1,000 booths selling antiques, produce and arts and crafts.

2021-09-25.name: Milwaukee Oktoberfest
2021-09-25.summary: There will be dachshund racing, stein-hoisting and brat-eating competitions as well as music and dancing at the War Memorial on the lakefront.

2021-09-25.name: Red Cliff Cultural Days
2021-09-25.summary: At this Ojibwe community just north of Bayfield, there will be a mini-powwow, sailboat rides, canoe races, traditional games, music, fireworks and sky lanterns.

2021-09-25.name: Harvest Fair
2021-09-25.summary: This free festival at the Wisconsin State Fairgrounds features lumberjack shows, pumpkin bowling, scarecrow-making, kids' rides and entertainment on three stages.

2021-09-25.name: All-State Barn Tour in Iowa
2021-09-25.summary: It's the Iowa Barn Foundation's annual             free, self-guided tour of restored historic barns.

2021-09-25.name: Spirit of the St. Croix Art Festival
2021-09-25.summary: Music, food and a juried art show along the St. Croix River, in Lakefront Park.

2021-09-25.name: Hyde Park Jazz Festival
2021-09-25.summary: Listen to non-stop music during this free festival at venues in and around Midway Plaisance, near the Museum of Science and Industry and Lake Michigan.

2021-09-25.name: Fermentation Fest
2021-09-25.summary: This fest in the scenic hills of southwest Wisconsin is not only about pickles and sourdough bread but also cheese, chocolate, beer and wine. There will be demos, tastings, music, art, dance and Scandinavian cow calling.

2021-09-25.name: Doors Open Milwaukee
2021-09-25.summary: More than 150 historic buildings — theaters, breweries, mansions, cathedrals, hotels, museums — are open to the public, and many offer free guided tours.

2021-09-25.name: Latino Heritage Festival
2021-09-25.summary: This festival at Western Gateway Park features Latino music, dancing, arts, cultural booths, children's activities and a corn-eating contest.

2021-09-25.name: Boats and Bluegrass
2021-09-25.summary: This family-oriented festival in Prairie Island Park, on the Mississippi River, features disc golf and paddling as well as music. A weekend pass includes camping and canoeing, and kids under 16 are free with an adult ticket. Buy tickets early to save money.

2021-09-25.name: Oktoberfest
2021-09-25.summary: Take polka-dancing lessons, enter the Bier Maiden or stein-holding contests and win costume prizes at this outdoor fest under tents  downtown.

2021-09-25.name: Octoberfest
2021-09-25.summary: This large downtown festival is more general civic celebration than German  festival, with an arts and crafts show, car show and music on five  stages.

2021-09-25.name: Chicago Live Again!
2021-09-25.summary: More than 40 of Chicago's marquee attractions, including the Joffrey Ballet, Chicago Symphony Orchestra, Lyric Opera and Second City will provide free, outdoors non-stop entertainment at Navy Pier to celebrate the return of live performance to Chicago.

2021-09-25.name: Fall Festival
2021-09-25.summary: There's an arts and crafts fair, children's games, contests and live music downtown.

2021-09-25.name: Taste of the Trail
2021-09-25.summary: On the Root River State Trail, sample local food, listen to music, tour a museum and visit the International Owl Center.

2021-09-25.name: Beef-A-Rama
2021-09-25.summary: In this northern Wisconsin lake-resort town, there's a Rump Roast Run, beef-eating contest and Parade of Beef.

2021-09-25.name: Johnny Appleseed Festival
2021-09-25.summary: In this northwest suburb of Chicago, there's pumpkin bowling, a pumpkin train and petting zoo, apple contests, music and a craft fair.

2021-09-26.name: Oktoberfest
2021-09-26.summary: There will be music, wagon rides, chainsaw carving, children's activities and, of course, beer from New Glarus Brewing.
